page.title: 08WETHERBY MAYOR
page.content:
Wetherby's Mayor is a councillor. He is elected by a secret ballot of the Council to be Chairman of the Council and Mayor. His job involves chairing Council Meetings and the Finance Committee, representing the town and other roles such as opening fetes and new buildings. He receives no salary and few expenses, but an official car is available for his use.
The present Mayor also has a full-time job as a local doctor. He does not have many powers as he can be overruled by the Leeds City Council or the Courts. The Mayor and Mayoress both have Chains of Office. His is silver and is insured for Â£1,000. The original Chains date back to 1894, but the present ones were donated in 1936.
